snippet.title: Fairfield grocer wants green revolution
snippet.content: AN ORGANIC greengrocer has taken a stand against plastic bags. Harvest Foodstore owner Andrew Panayi believes his shop is the first in busy Fairfield Village to ditch the plastic bag. RELATED: "Everyone on Station St has been talking about it but I thought this is ridiculous, let's just do it," he said. Customers are urged to bring their own reusable carry bags. Mr Panayi said customers had welcomed the change. "We've had overwhelming support from our shoppers," he said. "I think we've actually increased our customer base. It's never just about money; it's about building up relationships." is at 108 Station St, Fairfield.
